description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING WITH PATIO IN THE REAR GARDEN FOR USE AS A GRANNY ANNEXE.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [E100 - Rev.A, P101 - Rev.A, P102 - Rev.A]

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - (Flood condition) The development hereby approved shall implement the flood mitigation measures as submitted with the proposal titled: EA FRA Matrix and Flood Risk Assessment. These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity 

Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM F2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 5 - Removal of PD (Extensions/Alterations) - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the outbuilding hereby approved shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 6 - No External Lighting - No external lighting shall be installed without the prior approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - The development hereby permitted shall not be rented, sold independently or occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the main residential use of the dwelling known as  122 Cannon Hill Lane, Raynes Park, London, SW20 9ET

Condition : 8 - Landscaping - Notwithstanding the approved layout plans, no development shall take place until full details of a landscaping and tree planting scheme has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include on a plan, full details of the size, species, spacing, quantities and location of proposed plants and trees, together with any hard surfacing and means of enclosure. The works shall be carried out in the first available planting season following the completion of the development or prior to the occupation of any part of the development, whichever is the sooner, and any trees which die within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased or are dying, shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of same approved specification, unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation. All hard surfacing and means of enclosure shall be completed before the development is first occupied.
 
Reason: to protect and enhance the biodiversity of the development in the interest of nature conservation and to comply with the following development policies for Merton: policy G5 of the London Plan 2021; policy CS13 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DMO2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE
This planning permission contains restrictive conditions that state 'the proposal shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary' . As a result, the outbuilding must remain within ancillary use and cannot have a separate access, be rented out/sold, used to generate revenue or made into a separate dwelling from the main house unless approved in writing by the council. Any use other than ancillary (as defined within the delegated report) will make the development unauthorised and possibly subject to enforcement action

Condition : 11 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a planning permission only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.

Condition : 12 - INFORMATIVE - Section 106 Agreement 
This planning permission has a Section 106 Agreement which must be read in conjunction with it.
